result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hakeem Hicks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hakeem Hicks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Hakeem Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Defense has discovery and an offer, needs to review with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DY.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Hakeem Hicks in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hakeem Hicks appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
